utterances: (As Bell) Well, Spark, that's his job.
Do you - do you know how much cheaper a piece of coal is than a toy?
It's just the economics of Christmas.
(As Bell) I heard you sat on Santa's lap.
(As Spark) Yes, because he said I could, and he was nice.
(As Bell) I need you to hand in your access card.
You'll have time to gather your personal items, your slippers, whatever you need.
But tomorrow, you're going to report to toy factory 19.
(As elf at the factory) Green, red, red, green, red, green, green, green, green.
(As elf at the factory) Take hold, buddy.
Red, red, red, red, green, red, red, red.
(As elf at the factory) Beautiful, beautiful.
Just let yourself get into a rhythm.
(As Spark) So just one question, I guess.
What happens if I pull the wrong cable?
(As elf at the factory) Just pull the right cable.
I get that, but, I mean, just by accident.
(As elf at the factory) Remember, green cable, pre-assigned gifts.
(As elf at the factory) So just do the job.
(As Spark) I know, but if I accidentally were to pull the wrong one...
(As elf at the factory) A good kid would get a piece of coal.
(As Spark) Or a bad kid gets a present?
(As elf at the factory) Don't do that.
(As elf at the factory) Listen, you're the last line between the gifts and the kids, OK?
You put in the wrong thing, the kids are going to feel it.
I will not pull the wrong cable by accident.
And these boxes are wide open.
Anything could fall in there, right?
(As elf at the factory) Just coal or a gift.
(As Spark) ...Certainly not let anything fall in by accident.
(As elf at the factory) Welcome aboard, Spark.
(As elf at the factory) Keep it up.
(As elf at the factory) And stay away from the conveyor belt.
(As elf at the factory) Elf jelly.
(As Michael's mom) Oh, honey, he doesn't have anything under the tree.
HERBSTMAN: (As Michael Simmons) Here's one for me.
HERBSTMAN: (As Michael Simmons) It says from Santa.
HERBSTMAN: (As Michael's sister) What is it?
HERBSTMAN: (As Michael Simmons) Look, it's just what I wanted.
